event: testicular examination shows large warm tender bursa
abdomino-pelvic scan showed scrotal collection with air
evolution at 3 months marked by bourgeoning of scrotal tissue
clinical examination reveals ulcerated bourgeoning lesion on glans penis
decision to perform biopsy of glans
anatomopathological results showed squamous cell carcinoma of penis
additional clinical examination did not find inguinal adenopathy
MRI of penis showed tumor extending to cavernous cavities and urethra
taken to operating room for total penectomy with perineostomy
